results.webTitle: The Fiver | The outbreak of violent stupidity

results.firPara: Manchester City fans appear to have been filmed causing significant damage to toilets at Old Trafford after Wednesday nights derby in the EFL Cup.
results.secPara: A video posted online showed supporters kicking urinals and sinks from the wall after Uniteds 1-0 victory. They can be heard chanting City, City, City in the video, which was posted on Twitter by the @footyawayday account.
results.webTitle: City fans filmed ‘vandalising toilets’ at Old Trafford after Manchester derby

results.firPara: Have Manchester United turned another corner? José Mourinho was right when he said they stepped up their game in the second half against Manchester City to take control of the EFL Cup tie, and as they were the only team managing any shots on target he was possibly also correct in claiming they could have won by more than a single goal.
results.secPara: His assertion that beating City gives everyone a better feeling is only partly true, however. Winning a derby is always better than losing but United were playing only City reserves. Pep Guardiola did not exactly make a statement of aggressive intent when naming his side for Old Trafford, and in those circumstances it might be best not to assume that United have fully atoned for the wounding debacle at Chelsea.
results.webTitle: Manchester United heal wounds against City and hint at a healthier future | Paul Wilson

results.firPara: Scottish clubs need to play in a cross-border league to avoid being left behind, according to the chief executive of the countrys Football Association. A Champions League place for the winners is among the ideas being considered.
results.secPara: Stewart Regan believes such a concept would have football and financial benefits to clubs in countries such as Scotland and he is part of a Uefa working group investigating how cross-border competition can form part of the strategy at European footballs governing body.
results.webTitle: Scottish FA chief executive throws support behind cross-border leagues

results.firPara: Sunderland were forced to stay the night in Southampton following their exit from the EFL Cup on Wednesday evening, with thick fog preventing the team plane flying home immediately after the match.
results.secPara: David Moyess side were due to travel back to the north-east straight after the match but were unable to do so because of the weather conditions on the south coast. They planned to fly home from Bournemouth airport as noise restrictions in place at Southampton airport mean flights cannot take off between 11pm and 6am Monday to Saturday. After their unplanned overnight stay, Moyess squad did a light recovery session in Southampton on Thursday morning, a Sunderland spokesperson confirmed to the Guardian.
results.webTitle: Sunderland grounded in Southampton after fog prevents plane journey home

results.firPara: On a night when most Serie A watchers were left contemplating acts of God, Roma supporters saw the restoration of their strikers sight continue
results.secPara: On a night when most Serie A watchers were left contemplating acts of God, Roma supporters saw the restoration of their strikers sight continue
results.webTitle: Edin Dzeko's renaissance keeps Roma on pace at top of Serie A | Paolo Bandini

results.firPara: The Manchester United manager José Mourinho has been charged with misconduct over comments he made about the referee Anthony Taylor prior to the game against Liverpool, the Football Association has announced.
results.secPara: Mourinho, a serial offender when it comes to the FAs disciplinary unit, broke the rules forbidding members of his profession from speaking about referees in the buildup to matches, questioning whether it would be difficult for Taylor to have a very good performance when United visited Liverpool earlier this month.
results.webTitle: Manchester United’s José Mourinho charged by FA over referee comments

results.firPara: League One club have benefited from chairman Stewart Days investment but the financial picture is questionable and they aim to leave their long-time home

results.firPara: • Supporters clashed near the final whistle at the London Stadium
results.secPara: The Football Association has launched an investigation into the crowd trouble that marred Wednesday nights EFL tie between West Ham and Chelsea. Both clubs have also promised to ban for life any supporters found guilty of wrongdoing after trouble flared towards the end of the 2-1 victory for West Ham.
results.webTitle: Chelsea fans give accounts of being hit by coins at West Ham as FA investigates
